channel.title: Index on Notes by Bill Alive
channel.description: Recent content in Index on Notes by Bill Alive

item.title: Hubs
item.description: On this website, I use the word “hub” for a note that mainly exists as a topic for other notes to link to. Some hubs include: Zettelkasten Org Mode pandoc But I am more interested in the hubs that emerge on their own, as I link to them over time.

item.title: The Simple Rules for this Zettelkasten
item.description: This website of notes is a Zettelkasten with two simple rules: Each note should have one clear purpose. Each note should link to at least one other note. These rules support each other. The more clear the purpose of each note is, the more likely that other notes will benefit from linking to it. After each note, you can its backlinks. This gives you an instant glimpse of which notes are emerging as hubs.

item.title: This Website
item.description: A hub for notes about this website, notes.billalive.com.

item.title: Org Mode Keywords vs. Properties
item.description: Once you start Programming Org Mode, you’ll probably want to manipulate keywords and properties. They’re different, and you use different tools to work with them. For example, this post I’ve just started already has both keywords and properties at the file level: :PROPERTIES: :ID: 16b7ded8-3eda-444e-a419-b57a6e9e23a1 :END: #+title: Org Mode Keywords vs. Properties #+date: 2022-06-11 #+hugo_draft: true Properties live in :PROPERTIES: The (sole) property is in the :PROPERTIES: drawer: :PROPERTIES: :ID: 16b7ded8-3eda-444e-a419-b57a6e9e23a1 :END: Get an Org Mode Property You can retrieve that property programmatically with, e.

item.title: Org Mode
item.description: “Your life in plain text.” I spend more time in Org Mode than any other program. It’s starting to feel like my personal, extensible mech suit. https://orgmode.org/ Programming Org Mode

item.title: pandoc
item.description: A most excellent tool for transmogrifying text.

item.title: AlphaSmart Neo2: Factory Reset
item.description: If you get a strange error on your Neo2, e.g. “File overflow”, try a factory reset. WARNING: You’ll lose all your files. But your Neo2 will work again. Turn off. Hold down Right Shift and Backspace Turn on. Enter password: tommy Confirm that you want to reset. Done. When You Might Need to Reset I had to learn how to do this reset after I changed the watch battery on a Neo2 I’d just purchased.

item.title: pandoc: Make a List of URLs into an Ebook (EPUB)
item.description: Next time you start a series of blog posts that looks compelling, why not take a minute and save it as an ebook? It’s easy with pandoc. Example: The excellent Hypermodern Python series. I’ve read published Python books with far less substance. Also the, illustrations are gratuitously fantastic. So let’s write a quick script and save ourselves a copy: pandoc \ -M title:"Hypermodern Python" \ -M author:"Claudio Jolowicz" \ -o Hypermodern_Python_22601.
